title: Clean and serene beach - ideal for sunset
review_text:
We visited Neil Island in March 2019 and had the opportunity to enjoy a wonderful sunset at Laxmanpur Beach. Though it was cloudy, the sunset was worth seeing.. going behind clouds and then emerging as a round ball of orange. It was amazing. The beach is clean, sandy and it is wonderful to enjoy a walk on the seaside. 
Moreover, the small shops selling knickknacks on the sea shore were very tourist friendly. 
We really enjoyed the beach and I am sure others would too!! 
another beach again called Laxmanpur 2... was full of corals and had an amazing natural bridge.. that is water was very high at some point in history. We hired a guide who showed us so many live and dead corals all along the rocky beach.... and the water level kept rising. We all really enjoyed the trip. More

title: Must visit
review_text:
Firstly, there are two different Laxmanpur beach, No.1 and No. 2. Both beaches are a must visit. Now focusing on each of the beaches: 

Beach number 2 is were Howrah bridge and other natural rock formations can be seen. The beach has both live coral and dead coral. You must visit the beach along with a guide which you would easily get outside the beach. The guide would tell you the property of all the variety of corals and sea creatures which are easily visible on the rocky beach due to low tide. Beach number 2 is a must visit and is very different from any other beach in andaman islands. 

Beach number one is famous as a sunset point. It is a also a rocky beach but unlike beach number 2, there is sand on the shore and you can sit and enjoy the wind and the view. These beaches are a must visit if you are in Neil Island. More

review_text:
A veryvery silent beach on Neil Island is Laxmanpur Beach that is outshining every other beach on the island in terms of beauty and ravishing charm. We stayed at tango resort which is bang on the beach. 

Just walk along the beach and it will let you marvel at the beauty of the surrounding in a deep manner and the natural spectacle would enable you to revel in and linger the vacation you have planned to have over here. 

There is no activity to be done here . if you are that person who you love to grab a beer and watch the beach , then this beach is for you . More

title: FAMOUS FOR ITS ICONIC NATURAL BRIDGE
review_text:
Laxmanpur Beach of Neil Island is famous for its iconic natural bridge of rock. This beautiful small island has some of the least crowded and clean beaches of Andaman. Its truly an amazing experience to be there. 

Important Infos: 
1. You can reach this island by ferries (opt private ferries as they are more comfortable). 
2. If you are running short of time, or if your budget is limited and you don't wana spend on Hotel booking in Neil Island, then you can plan a day visit to Laxmanpur Beach. 
3. The ferry drops you at this Island in morning and the same ferry picks you up in evening and takes you to Port Blair or Havelock. So plan accordingly. 
4. Laxmanpur beach has restaurants, fruit stalls and stalls that sells souvenirs. 
5. You can pre book a cab which will pick you up from jetty and takes you to Beaches or you can book after reaching there. 
6. Ferry connectivity to this Island is limited so stick to timings and be on time to catch your return ferry, else you will have to stay a day over there. More

I could see some different tough fruits on the beach. I felt the whole beach belongs to me as only 3-4 people I could find in the stretch of 3 KM's. In the early morning 5.30 to 8 am the beach was full of water due to high tide while when I saw in the late morning around 10 am, water had receded due to low tide and lots of corals were bare on the beach. I liked the beach more at early morning. In the evening there is a market on the beach selling artcrafts, mungabeads, pearls, sandstones etc More

review_text:
• Visited with a group of friends of 13 people.

title: GREAT PLACE TO WATCH THE SUNSET AT NEIL ISLAND
review_text: Also known as Laxmanpur I, this is the place to watch the sunset at Neil Island. We were a bit late to reach here from Laxmanpur II after seeing Howrah Bridge, so the sun was well down. However the beach was extremely active. An extremely scenic beach, it is very akin to Radhanagar in Havelock, but not as clean. We hung on till it was nice and dark and saw a ship leaving the harbour and its lights disappearing into the deep sea. The beach closes by 5 pm or thereof, so it is recommended that one reaches it by 3 pm to have an hour of swimming before the sun sets. More

title: Beautiful but not out of the world either
review_text:
It was good but nothing too wow. More beautiful is the surroundings and the background of the beach itself. The kind of vegetation you see here it would be a rare thing to witness in Indian mainland that too on a beach. 

It's a rocky beach which is pretty flat and hence you can go bit into the waters during sunset to capture the images in your eyes as well your camera 

As an experience I would rate it 3.5/5

title: Excellent Sunset & Sea shells
review_text: This beach has excellent sunset. I feel one the best sunset experiences in the world will be here. The sand is white bright & silver mixed with sea shells, which is very excellent. We cannot swim here due to rocky patch further. The water is super transparent giving, green, blue sheds as per depth of sea at various areas. You can enjoy snack, tea, coconut water & shopping at local stalls here.

title: Beautiful view of the sunset, crowded in the evenings
review_text: ...check high and low tide timings and plan accordingly if you wish to swim. Food and craft stalls cater to visitor's needs

title: Gorgeous and somewhat populated
review_text:
The ride through Neil Island should be done on a scooter. Beautiful drive with lush green trees that canopy over the road. The beach is fairly clean but has a lot of foot traffic so you're going to see some litter here and there. 

The sunset is excellent to see. Perfect for a timelapse. Food stalls are located around the bend of the beach but know they can OVERCHARGE YOU.

title: Just another beach for Sunset
review_text:
This beach is crowded during the sunset time. We took an Auto from Coconhuts resort to laxmanpur beach which costed us Rs 100(One way). 

From the place where vehicle stops we have to walk left when we reach the beach to reach the sunset point.The walk will be about less than 10 minutes. It will be crowded at the sunset time.The water will be far from the sea shore because of low tide in evening,i did not see anyone bathing in this beach,there are no water sports here either. there are many shops selling items made of shells etc and also shops selling tea,chaats,mango,maggi(noodles) etc. We had a local variety of mango here which costed us Rs 10.00,it was good. 

I found this beach very average.If you are coming by Auto take the contact number of auto driver call him before ten minutes,as he may take ten minutes to reach the beach. Reach this place by 4:15-4:30 Pm. Sun sets here by 5:20- 5:30 Pm. More

title: Amazing sunset
location: Salt Lake City, West Bengal, India
review_text: Great place for photography .we managed to cycle down.... However over crowded with tourists...many shops and food stalls available.

title: Best Beach at Neil Island
review_text: This was definitely the best beach at Neil Island. Expect it to be crowed during sunset. The view was mesmerising.

title: Brilliant sunset point in Neil Island
review_text:
After you cab reaches you to the parking lot surrounded by old rainforest you'll walking down the kilometer long beach to reach the west end of the beach. The walk is worthy as there are beautiful sitting arrangement made of bamboo stick where you can enjoy the beautiful sunset against the coral reef, with a cup of hot tea & some snacks readily available in the beachside shops. 

The beach has sceanic beauty of dense rainforest by the side of white sand beach. In low tide corals get exposed, and beach is covered with parts of corals & oyesters. Beware of collecting any such coral or oyester as all are protected by wildlife acts. It's absolutely illegal to collect any marine life product in whole Andaman and one can find signboards on the beaches stating the punishment and fine for collecting such things. More

title: Beautiful sunset point..
review_text: Amazing view of sunset.. Nice beach to play in sand.. After the sunset we had tasty onion pakoda and Maggi at this beach..

title: white sands blue waters
review_text: this is a clean beach, no clutter, no noisy people (except of weekends perhaps) and the water is such a pleasure to wade into.

title: nice beach with white sand
review_text:
good beach specially to see the sunset and its a good attraction for tourist. 
must visit this place in evening

title: excellent for Sun Set view and walking....no water sports at this location.
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text:
No water sports at this Location ....for sunset and evening walk point of view best location..... 
some Food, Tea and Vending stalls also available to spent a good evening here.

title: Sunset
review_text:
Beach and sunset are excellent. 
Parking is very far. You have to walk one km before you reach sunset point. 
Good pakodas available

title: Must visit for Sunset
review_text: This beach provides spectacular view for Sunset. You need to reach around 4 PM to see the sunset here. Also the road leading to beach is beautiful. Beach is generally crowded with people.

title: Best beach to view the sunset
review_text: Just a few km away from jetty this place is best to view the mesmerizing sunset.You can stay here till 6:00 PM

title: Popular sunset point beach
review_text: It is the most popular beach at Neil Island to watch sunset and practically all tourists at Neil would be there at that time, making it a bit crowded and also littered. But it has great views and you can spend a good fun filled evening.

title: Best for sunset n relax
review_text: If you want to watch sunset nd relax. than this place is best for you. Its very neat nd clean place. It is most beautiful nd clean beach on Havelock n neil Islands. But on this place you cant go in water as it is rocky area. But very clean n perfect for relaxing.

title: Yet another beach
review_text:
This one is famous for sunset but as the weather was cloudy did not enjoy much. 

You can have long walk as it's pretty lengthy beach. There are plenty of small shops available if you want to have some food. 

No water activities are available here. Please make sure to visit natural bridge as it's different from normal beaches and you can witness live corals during low tide. 

Good for relaxed ending of a day.

title: Good Beach but not very clean
review_text: This Beach was just on our Hotel and we have gone to this beach 5 times during our stay, It is not very clean, but ok, Bharatpur Beach and Sitapur Beaches are the best.

title: Sunset point!
review_text: The main and the most amazing place to watch the sunset. You can just chill at the beach, play with the local dogs and after the sun is down also just chill out and have light snack with beer.

title: sunset..just wow..
review_text: sunset view is really good...also lot of eating options at beach like kanda bhaji, maggie etc which is really tasty..it feels awesome having cup of tea with kanda bhaji while watching sunset...

title: A great experience during sunset
review_text:
If you want to enjoy being you ... a perfect place ..watching sunset. You will easy spend 2-3 hrs in evening. 

There is a very small stall for tea/coffee/Onion pakora/maggi .. so that is a bonus .. hot evening snacks ..just on the beach .. in a peaceful environment & gentle breeze off the water.

title: Another Touristy Beach
review_text: A stone throws distance from the main jetty this relatively small beach boasts of numerous water activities most popular being glass bottom boat rides. You are free to swim in the water which is quite shallow for some distance.

title: Amazing beach to watch sunset
review_text: This was an amazing beach to watch sunset. The sand is really nice to walk on. The place was filled with couples snapping away the beautiful sunset pictures. It's 3km from the jetty and easily accessible. There are couple of maggi joints on the beach. You need to walk to extreme left to view the sunset.

title: Sunset beach
review_text:
This beach is known as sunset beach but we missed the sunset :) 
it is a very clean beach and just a walk on this amazing beach can bring the romance back in life :)

title: If you are Neil already, then visit otherwise avoid
review_text:
This is again a regular beach and nothing special here to mention. Compared to Radha Nagar beach, this is nothing. They call it sunset point but the views are not so clear as Radha Nagar. 

The beach is not so accessible as the shores are cover with corels and weeds

title: what a beautiful beach
review_text: one side crystal clear water another side full greenish water.really what a beach to see.it is one of best beach in Andaman.

title: SUN SET POINT.
review_text: This is a beautiful beach, full of dead corals. so you can't take a bath here. But awesome experience of sun set.

title: Nice beach
review_text: Beach is very nice. It has sunset view. Water is clean but beach can be maintained properly. Must visit in Neil island

title: Beautiful peaceful beach
review_text: It is a very beautiful beach with white sands and clear blue waters. Generally there are not much tourists here, but I simply liked it. It was lovely. There were corals at the beach side hence you cannot swim here. Also there are no water sports or other activities that happen here. This beach is good to relax and enjoy the sunset peacefully.

title: Laxmanpur beach - loving sunset
review_text:
This is another one of the best beach in neil island. Here you can't swin and this beach famous for sunset. 

Here you no need to go so far to buy some stuff (maggi, pakora, daal chaat etc) all shop is at the beach. 

The sunset time is 4:30.

title: sunset point
review_text: mostly famous for its sunset views, usually free from tourists during the other times... didnt see people entering the water much.. but got crowded during the sunset time.

title: Neil Island- Laxmanpur beach
review_text:
Its an another beautiful beach to visit, but we can't swim there as there is no fine sand. 
Its only 1-2 kms from Neil Island ferry and Very nice sight seeing place with family. Plan to go and have fun.

title: marvelous sunset point
review_text: Best sunset point of andaman.Walk to the end of the beach otherwise u can not see the real sunset.At the end of the beach u can find many tea shops.U dont have to go to the shop they will bring u fast food and tea on the beach with reasonable price.Go there before 4.15 pm in winter season.

title: Neat & clean beach. Sunset point
review_text: Laxmanpur beach is 2 KM from Jetty. It is a beach from where sunset can be seen. This is a place for clicking mesmerizing memories.

title: Laxmanpur Beach Neil Iseland
review_text: The beach is good but development is necessary. It is the beach from which Sun Set may be views. Laxmanpur Beach is located at a distance of around 2 km from Neil Jetty. This beach is situated in Laxmanpur village. It has white shell sand along with shallow water that makes it an ideal place for snorkeling. The beach is favorable for activities like sun basking and swimming as well. Laxmanpur is popular for sunset. Enjoy the beautiful white sand of the beach and we can find varieties of colorful stones and shells on the beach. But we can't go into water or swim, as waters are very shallow and lots rocks so it's too dangerous to go into waters. More

title: Famous for sun set
review_text: Most of the tourists visit Neil, gathers here for sunset which looks very nice. This is a half circular beach with nice clear sand. The sand is white and and soft looking. You can enjoy the tea, pakuri, maggi etc sitting on the beach. Some other small shops of sea items are there. Generally the tourists reaching in the evening from Havlock directly go to the beach because sun sets little early in Andaman. The wave & colour of sea also very charming. Nice place for relaxing.

title: Best sunset in the Andamans
review_text: If you are looking for the best sunsets in the whole of Andaman islands look no further and head straight towards this beach, you will have an experience of a lifetime (atleast i had).

title: No proper signboard
review_text: We went there in the evening to basically see the sunset. The place where the car left us opened up on the beach and we waited there hoping to see the sunset. Then someone told us that the sunset was to be seen at the other extreme of the beach. It was getting to be time, so we hurried all across the beach to the other end. By the time we reached, the sunset was already half way underway and we got just a glimpse of the setting sun. If they had put some kind of sign board there to first time guide tourists, we wouldn't have wasted time sitting around at the wrong place. More

title: Most attractive Beach
review_text: Entire Neil Island is best place, each beach has their own beauty. Laxmanpur Beach one of the best peaceful beach in Neil Island...

title: Just sit and enjoy sunset
review_text: I never thought that an Indian beach can have such a beautiful location and amazing sun set, Long beach and picture perfect

title: Out of the world experience
review_text:
I am a frequent traveller and I have been to a lot of beaches in India and abroad. Believe me, this is one of the most unique beach as the waves are triangular in nature due to 2 shores meeting up. 
Sunset from here is simply an amazing site. One has to walk towards the left side of the beach to catch this site and sit and relax with breeze flowing along and you can also have good tea, pakoras and maggi from various stalls out their. 
This is not a beach ideal for swimming as one might get hurt because of stones and corals. The beach is super clean with white sand. One can easily spend hours sitting here, definitely one of the beast beaches I have been to. More

title: awsome beach with white sand
review_text: awsome beach with white sand, this is place where two shores meet forming triangular waves. excellent view to watch

title: Nice Sunset at Laxamanpur Beach
review_text: visited with family at Laxamanpur Beach, Neil Island, Andaman on 23rd October, 2017. View of Sunset was really unforgettable. Enjoyed a lot.

title: Quite Beach full of Corals
review_text: Bhatapur beach is really stunning one with shades of water varying from Blue To Green. The crystal clear water gives insight of corals, though it makes beach not a good option for swimming as you are likely to get injured due to corals.

title: A must visit!
review_text: Had an opportunity to spend half day at this beach. This has high tide as evening happens. The best part of this beach is neat and clean. Very well know for sunset. We were the first to enter the beach even before the eatery shops open up. U can sit and relax and watch beach. No one to disturb. By evening lot of shops open up and offer nice onion pakodas, Maggi and bhel and tea! Nostalgic! A must visit.

title: Awesome Sunset beach - perfect Relaxation.
review_text:
Laxmanpur beach is surely the unsung hero of andamans. Relatively not much written about but the sunset here can be amazing. Pity we didn't get to see the complete magnificence of it as it was cloudy. You must walk towards the left side of the beach where the beach turns most people dnt care to walk till here. You can really enjoy the sunset and the low tide from here. Especially good for photography as at the other end you have huge trees which create a mystic magic during the sunset. title: Nice beach for sunset
review_text: Good beach to view sunset; and see some marine life. Clear water; but full of dead corals. clean beach partly sandy, partly rocky.

title: Great sunset views
review_text: Can't swim here (lots of large rocks & waves) but it's a great place to wade in the water and catch the sunset. You can snap some amazing photographs too!

title: Sunset point
review_text: Relaxing.Snacks are sold.Calming end of the day.Little walk through the forest.Not much crowded or noisy like some other beaches.

title: Splendid sundown..
review_text: Here Sunset is the only event that makes an average beach to a very good beach. Everything is same to the other beaches in Andaman, clifftop greenery (specially in neil island beaches) turquoise blue water, white sand beach, coral rocks, azure blue sky, shallow stretched beach, all are more or less same. But stunning sunset makes the difference. We stayed in pearl park resort which is the nearest point to sunset. But there is no change room so big no to take bath or swim. You can enjoy sunset and take some snacks like pakora-maggi, cha, but lots of mosquitoes are therein the stalls so better to carry mosquito repellent in your bag specially for your babies. More

title: A Beach to view Sunset
review_text: The beach is more or less clean. Calm and quiet. Possible to take a bath. Best time to visit is afternoon to view the Sunset. The lush green forest just adjoining to the beach is fabulous.

title: Good clean sand and crystal clear water
review_text: Unfortunately, the day we went was very cloudy and there was not much sunset view. But the long beach with its white sand is really unique. The water is clean and just walking on the shore is very relaxing.

title: Sunset point
review_text: This beach is like a sunset point for visitors. Once more clean beach of Andman with nice view of sunset point. My resort was near by this beach so enjoyed sun set here. One has to reach here by 4:00 pm to enjoy the sunset.

title: Best Sunset View
review_text:
1) This place is a must visit place as you would be standing at the corner (edge) of the Neil island viewing the sunset. 
2) If there is low tide please do walk on top of the coral a bit ahead and the feel is amazing 
3) You are only allowed to stay there till 6pm and after that its pitch dark 
4) Small shops serve Masala Maggie , Jhaalmuri and tea which is really tasty. 
5) Food items would be a bit expensive consdering the fact you are on an Island

title: Absolutely stunning !!
review_text: Every beach in Neil Island is beautiful. However Laxmanpur is famous for its sunset. Lovely evening view makes your holiday even better,

title: A beach that brings you closer to nature.
review_text: We stayed in a resort just on the beach and the Laxmanpur beach was a beautiful beach to just spend time looking at the quiet blue water of the ocean.

title: Fantastic sunset Must Visit
review_text: Beautiful beach with spectacular sunset. The beach is rocky and hence not meant for swiming. The sunset point is less rocky but not for swimming. The sunset is amazing and a photographer delight with the ocean islands and the sky. Must visit.

title: The best beach at Neil
review_text: It is the largest beach on Neil island. We lied down on the pristine, superfine sand for hours. The cool breeze, the musical sound of the ocean , the peace , can't be explained only can be felt. It is totally recommended for those who seek solace and serenity.

title: Beach with rocky sea but with nice sand
review_text: Beach with rocky sea but with nice wide sand gives you a great view for a sun set as it circles one of the corners of the island. As Neil Island is very small you can visit all the beaches in the same day.

title: Must Visit Sunset Point
review_text: This is sunset point at Neil with a great view . The beach is beautiful and has an unique view of cross tides of the water . A must visit place

title: Simply beautiful
review_text: We had reached the beach around 4 pm. It was a spot for sun set view. Although we found clouds hovering, we were positive to see the sun setting. The beautiful hue of the sky coupled with the pristine sands and waves just made such a fabulous view. It lies in a corner of Neil island, so the beach is somewhat U-shaped. Must visit place.

title: Cleanest beach
review_text: Very good beach, all white sand, no crowd. 80% rocks are there but there is a place to go into the water. Not much vendor and seller on this beach.

title: A must place for sunset
review_text: This beach provides the best view of sun set. White Sandy Beach, clear blue water and amazing sunset - adds the charm to your holiday.

title: Sunset Point
review_text: Beach is vibrant and famous for sunset. You can sit here and relax while sipping hot tea or savouring Maggie noodles. Nice place to spent evening in Neil Island

title: A must place for sunset
review_text: A must place for a sunset experience. Not felt comfortable to get into water as most of the shore got covered with rocks. But a worthy to be there for a beautiful sunset experience.

title: perfect sunset view
review_text: this beach is famous for Sunset. and near to the jetty. it provides a perfect view of sunset subject to weather conditions. no water activities are carried out here. just go and enjoy the nature

title: lovely
review_text: nature at its perfection i...white sand ...crsytal clear water...lovely corals mesmerising sunset ...it couldn't be better than this

title: Visit to Laxmanpur beach
review_text: Beautiful beach with very good greenery. We have enjoyed sunset at Laxmanpur beach which was memorable to me.

title: Go to Neil only for this place
review_text: Not to be missed at all, if you are in Neil. Cleanest and the most beautiful beach of all. Spend maximum time here.

title: Beautiful sunset but not for swimming
review_text: When on Neil, go to Laxmanpur for the sunset, but not for swimming. Local refreshment stalls will have chai, bhajiyas and maggi noodles. The beach shifts every 6 months, due to winds and tides!

title: Amazingly Beautiful and breathtaking
review_text: This beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Andaman Islands. With its natural beauty and white sands, it is very quiet and serene and one can enjoy a peaceful walk down to the sunset point and then watch the amazing view of the sunset there. It is mostly isolated so a very good place to relax.

title: Breathtaking view Beach
review_text: We had great time of our life with almost no one around for hours on this beach ( this beach is very near to pearl park resort - walk able distance )

title: sunset beach
review_text: great sunset view but it is a long walk from the drop point to the beach. a bi crowded compared to the other beaches.

title: Sunset watching beach
review_text:
We were staying in a nearby hotel. From the hotel, the beach was walking distance. And hence we walked down to the beach in the evening to watch the sunset. 
The vast beach and the open expanse itself is breathtaking and awesome. Makes you realize the beauty of nature and relieves you of stress. 
We watched the sunset, but could not see it dip into the ocean due to clouds at the bottom. Nonetheless it was great. 
The stalls at the beach serve maggi, pakora, chai to keep hunger at bay. Don't be too finicky about hygiene here. 
Great beach.

title: Naaaah
review_text: Due to amount of crowd the beach water is not clear ..it is quite dirty compared to other beaches the only best part is the sunset.

title: Sun Set Point and nice scenic views
review_text: Nice beach for photo lovers. Best time to visit is around 4:00 P.M so that you can enjoy beautiful sunset. Place very ideal for photography. Beach is not suitable for bathing as there is no changing rooms/toilets here

title: A memorable place to spend evening
review_text: A brisk walk along the beach to the corner of the island to see sunset ... will stay in memory for long.

title: excellent beach
review_text: Fantastic beach, white sand, must go for the sun set, sun set timing around 5.30 to 5.40 p.m. simply amazing sun set view.....

title: Good
review_text: Very good location for viewing sun set & many more corals on the beach it's seem very good to see corals good for nature lovers & foto shoot out lovers

title: Sunset Mesmerizing
review_text: Its a rocky beach, dont expect much expect a few maggi and coconut and trinkets sellers. Go just before sunset that is around 4,30 PM.

title: Excellent beach
review_text: It's one of the best beaches around the world. As soon as you come here, will feel feel to take bath. Otherwise just sit and relax.

title: One of the famous beach at Neil Island
review_text: Day four (23.12.2016), we reached Neil island via Makruzz cruse. Reached at 3.10 pm and on the way to hotel we went to visit Laxmanpur beach. It is a spectacular tourist attraction. There are a few eatable stalls beside the beach. We were hungry at that time, so hot tea with fried pakodda made the mind fresh.

title: Laxmanpur Sunset not to be missed
review_text:
Go to this beach in the end to view sunset. 
You will get to see lot of corals on the beach. 
To eat- you will get maggie, tea and other snacks options at a very economical price

title: Mesmerizing!
review_text:
This beach is famous for the sunset views it offers and trust me, you will not be disappointed. You have to walk 500-700 mts to the other side of the cliff to watch the sunset. The water is so clear that it will make you get into the water and take a dip, so don't forget to carry an extra pair of clothes. 
After the sunset, just grab a cup of tea, sit down and relax soaking in the beauty and the music those waves produce.

title: Nice place to spend eve
review_text:
Nice place to spend evening in Neil with friends. Coffee and snacks are served in the beach by Island Natives. This is not suitable for doing any water sports 
This is kind of slightly over rated when comparing to other beaches in Neil Island.

title: Nice Sunset point
review_text: It's one of the best sunset point in Andaman. The beach is calm and quiet . It's a quite clean beach.

title: Good evening snacks available at not so good beach
review_text: Laxmanpur is a long beach in "V" shape. Its neither beautiful nor clean like the beaches of Havelock island. The food stalls on the beach selling hot tea, Maggie, variety of pakoras and chaat items is worth a try.

title: White sand and sunset
review_text: The roads are awesome. One can enjoy sunset by sitting those amazing white sands. After 5.30 no one allowed to stay on the beaches.

title: Awesome colours in the sky
review_text:
Totally under-rated and in the shadows of its more popular cousin in Havelock, Lakshmanpur beach at Neil is one of the places to jet lie in the sand and wait for the sun to go down the sea (Yes, I know the Sun stays there and we go up, but who cares!) 
Its a beautiful beach in a lazy setting and perfect avenue for one to sit down and let the wonders of nature sink in. 
The colours you see in the sky as the sun sets are something you have got to experience yourself.

title: Sunset beach
review_text: It is a sun set beach and a beautiful beach. Do one visit atleast , 1 hr needed for visit. can be visited by byke.

title: Beautiful sunset and Tasty Maggi
review_text: Visit this beach at evening for view of a beautiful sunset and white sand beach while enjoying Maggi and Bhelpuri from beach side vendors.

title: Sunset point of neil
review_text: We went to laxmanpur for sunset only...awesome view..but too crowded..we didn't went in water as were already tired fue to activities at bharatpur..u can spend 1 hour 4.30 to 5.30

title: great sunset view beach - long stretch for walking & just relaxing...
review_text: Laxmanpur beach in Neil Island is a perfect location for watching sunsets- one of the best views in the world I beleive!! The beach is very long with white sand and pristine blue waters. The water is full of corals which get exposed in low tide - so no water sports here. There are some shops near the sunset point to get snacks. Otherwise this is a place to just chill- enjoy the weather and watch the sunset. Highly recommended!!

title: The sunset beach
review_text: This beach is at the west tip of of the island. It offers a great sunset view. During low tide the beach the stones can be seen. Its a beautiful beach to just spend time on. In the evening , a few food stalls are put up by the locals. Just have a nice cup of chai and pakora and enjoy the sunset.

title: Sunset Point
review_text: This beach is amazing. it's a stress buster place where you'll love to hangout with friends and loved ones. Don't forget to take your DSLR. you'll love the natural beauty and white sands.

title: Good for Sunset
review_text:
This beach is around 10mis from Neil Jetty. 
This beach is not shallow so not advisable for swimming but the sand is pure white and blue water and it has a very good sunset view.

title: Cant be a better beach in India than this
review_text: Beautiful and so clean that you wont think this place exists in India. Amazing sunset views and soft sand.

title: Nice place to unwind
review_text: Laxmanpur is on the northern edge of the Neil Island. I stayed in Tango Beach resort which is on this beach. The road leading to this place is covered with tall trees.

title: Beauty of Sunrise and sun set.
review_text: Very lovely beach with spectacular views. Don't miss the beach by any means. Lifetime experience from Indian soil.

title: Long clean beach for sunset viewing, plenty of snacks shops
review_text: The beach is beautiful, wide and long with cleanliness that one does not find at other Indian beaches. We enjoyed the sunset around 5 PM. There are several snacks shops that serve hot pakodas, jhal muri, fresh fruits, tea coffee and cold drinks, fresh coconut water. All very friendly. Must visit.

title: Good sunset point
review_text: Nice view of sunset but nothing much.. shores are bit rocky should would not recommend swimming. Good place to get some romantic view and pics.

title: Coral beach of Neil island
review_text: This beach is filled with corals. Not suitable for diving or swimming but you can enjoy a beautiful sunset. This place is very windy.

title: Good for site seeing.. Awesome sunset
review_text:
Visited this beach in Jan 2017. Rocky beach so dont plan to go for bath here. 
I found it suitable for sitting at the shore and watch the natural beauty. If you are a camera lover, ready to capture the best sunset there at the beach. 
Awesome view. 

Although I advice to plan evening trip to this beach only. You can visit other places till 3 and then come here to have a good time. 

No water activities no games and nothing much to see there.

title: Mesmerizing sunset !!!
review_text:
White fine sand...beautiful blue water....gentle and inviting waves....and an exceptional sunset make this beach a must visit when at Neil island...The beach is more or less in a peninsula shape...sunset on left hand side of it...fallen tree logs...white in color make it a treat for photographers.... 

Plenty of vendors on beach selling tit bits to eat...chaiwallah...Maggie...and many more...you will also find vendors selling lobsters, prawns and crabs....Some locals may also reach out to you at the beach to ask for crabs/prawns/lobsters for dinner...they cook at home and parcel it to your hotel room...decent rate and negotiable a bit...I tried one of them and found the Crab tasty.. 

I did not find anyone swimming in sea or playing in water...guess the water is deep ...though saw a couple of people snorkeling(unassisted, they knew swimming) in early morning... 

I visited the beach in the evening and morning and was kept busy photographing by the immense beauty of the place.. 

A must visit More

title: Clean and Serene
review_text: Undoubtedly, Laxmanpur beach in Neil Island is one of the most beautiful beach in Andaman after Radhanagar. Just about an hour’s ferry ride from Havelock island, it’s a must see in the Andaman travellers’ itinerary. From there we went to Laxmanpur Beach, about 15 minutes drive. The beach is very safe for bathing. However, the seabed is full or coral which makes it difficult to walk on the rough surface. There are beautiful sculptural coral lying everywhere in the beach but as per laws of the land one cannot collect them and leave Andaman. All the corals needs to be declared and left behind in the Airport, unless it is purchased (receipt to be shown). The beach is clean. the horizon is a magnificent culmination of various shades of blue, playing with soft white clouds. An awesome place for landscape photography to bring out the ultra wide angle lenses. We had a delicious Bengali lunch at the hotel abutting the beach, with Rosogollas in dessert! This was the last island we visited in Andaman, and it really was a grand finale to our tour. Unfortunately we had to leave before the sunset, so we missed the rendezvous of the dusk. More

title: Clean Clear Composed
review_text:
Laxmanpur Beach is the longest beach on Neil Island. A beach that starts from the Neil Jetty and extends far off till your eyes can see. It's white sand with the blue and green waters in the backdrop give a nice visual throughout the day. A distant view of the big brother Havelock Island is also a treat. The beach is followed by a coral bed before the sea takes over. One end of the beach i.e. towards the jetty has a mangrove thicket which is a treat to watch and of course a place to have a walk in if you are a wildlife enthusiast. The mangrove habitat is varied and mesmerizing. The other end of the beach is green forest of huge trees and this is the very famous sunset point of Neil Island. Truly the sunset from this point is magnificent and picturesque. 

What more can I say? Laxmanpur beach is special to me as my resort was located on this beach so had a lot of fun on this beach. And yes one of my best memories of life is having a romantic candle light dinner on Laxmanpur Beach with the subtle sea at my feet and beautiful yellow moon in the star studded sky...an experience of lifetime. title: A beach to view the sun set..
review_text:
Located at 2 kms. from Neil Island Jetty, this beach is well known as the sun set point. The only road from jetty to laxmanpur beach houses some of the resorts like Sea Shell, Tango Beach Resort and Pearl Park beach resort. 
From Tango Beach Resort to the sun set point, a small stretch of the road is bumpy. 
Once you reach the beach, you have to walk some distance on the beach to witness the sunset. Generally tourists are seen flocking this beach at sun set time which is between 4.30 p.m. to 4.45 p.m. in the first week of December. 

This beach is surrounded by huge trees on one side. The white sandy beach filled with dead rocky corals is the best spot to sit and watch the sun set. It is not ideal for swimming on account of rocky dead corals. The water is crystal clear and you can clearly see the corals and stones inside the water. 
Except for a small road side tea vendor, nothing else is available to eat or drink on the beach. More
